person.persName: John J. Thomas (Provisional Congress of the Confederate States)

body.p: A Kentucky farmer, soldier, and politician. Worked as a surveyor and farmer in Christian County, Kentucky. Worked as a clerk in the United States Post Office in Washington, D.C. during the James K. Polk administration. Married to Kate Thomas. Father of Lewis M. Thomas, John Q. Thomas, Pendleton Thomas, and Annie Thomas. Owned fifty enslaved persons in 1860. Served as a member of the Kentucky House of Representatives from 1851 to 1853. Returned to farming in Christian County from 1853 to 1861. Served as a member of the Provisional Congress of the Confederate States from 1861 to 1862. Served as an aide to General John “Cerro Gordo” S. Williams in the Army of the Confederate States from 1862 to 1865.
